---
title: 'Vue Tip: Use Optional Chaining in Templates'
description: "It's possible to use optional chaining in Vue templates."
date: '2022-02-19'
technology: 'vue'
---

It's possible to use [Optional Chaining](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/Optional_chaining) in Vue 3 templates:

> The optional chaining operator (?.) enables you to read the value of a property located deep within a chain of connected objects without having to check that each reference in the chain is valid.

Here's a simple Vue component that uses the optional chaining operator:

```vue
<template>
  <p v-if="data?.user?.name">Name: {{ data?.user?.name }}</p>
  <p>Age: {{ data?.user?.age ?? 0 }} years old</p>
</template>

<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';

const data = ref({ user: { name: 'Michael' } });
</script>
```

The following Vue SFC playground shows the rendered output of this Vue component:

<iframe width="100%" height="500" src="https://sfc.vuejs.org/#"/>
<br />
